author: China Insights-SOHTV
description:
Across China and beyond, thousands of workers are struggling to get the wages they rightfully earned. From factories and schools to construction sites abroad, Chinese companies — often linked to the CCP — are failing to pay their employees on time, sparking waves of protests and unrest. This video uncovers the growing crisis of wage arrears, exposing how ordinary workers suffer while powerful corporations evade accountability.

Watch to learn how this systemic issue is affecting lives both inside China and at international projects like the collapsed Bangkok building linked to China Railway No. 10 Engineering Group.
title: Unpaid Wages Crisis Hits Chinese Workers at Home and Overseas

author: China Insights-SOHTV
description: Sometimes our minds hold onto big prejudices—like a mountain—but this adorable video reminds us not to jump to conclusions! When the owner wakes the cat up because of snoring sounds, it turns out the baby was the one snoring all along. A sweet and funny moment that breaks through any assumptions. Watch, laugh, and don’t forget to like and subscribe! 🐱👶💤
title: Cat and Baby Sleeping Together – Who’s Snoring? Breaking Prejudice Like a Mountain!#shorts

author: China Insights-SOHTV
description:
Xiaomi’s SU7 was praised as the ultimate “Made in China” car—a patriotic answer to Tesla. State media and nationalist influencers rallied behind it. Thousands rushed to buy it, believing they were supporting the rise of Chinese innovation.

But beneath the national pride was a fragile machine.

Within weeks: cracked brakes, fake “carbon fiber” hoods, system errors, and most horrifying of all—a fiery crash that killed three young women when the doors failed to open. What was sold as a national triumph turned into a deadly illusion.

This video unpacks:

How state-fueled nationalism hyped an untested EV into a symbol of pride

The chilling footage and survivor reports from the fatal SU7 crash

Why so many young Chinese consumers trusted a brand over evidence

How “patriotic consumption” masked real risks—and who paid the price

This is not just a product failure. It’s the collision of propaganda, blind faith, and the cost of awakening.

🔔 Subscribe for raw, uncensored stories from insid
title: CHINA’S TESLA: HOW NATIONALISM BLINDED A GENERATION AND TURNED XIAOMI’S SU7 INTO A TRAGEDY
